Of all the evils heaped upon black people in this country 
 in the 20th century , it seems to me that job discrimination 
 , more than anything broke the resilience of black men .
 Men need to work .They need to know that the sounds of 
 their own exhaustion help to create the kind of world in which they live .

The refusal to honor a black man\'s work-to let him know that the smell of his \n sweat led to just recompense , that his hands were his survival , and his sinews his passport to success \n - has led to the degradation , the hostility and the lethargy now threatening to engulf us
